website_summaries.verdict: If you prioritize camera mobility over live streaming and HD quality, Kidde's RemoteLync model will definitely deliver, but its price seems a little steep given the diminished specs.
pros: Kidde's $189 RemoteLync is a solid security camera, complete with responsive IFTTT- and geofencing-based Home/Away arming and motion sensing capabilities, as well as a built-in siren to scare off intruders
It also operates on a rechargeable low-power battery and comes with 12 hours of free cloud storage
cons: The RemoteLync is essentially the same camera as the Homeboy, a product we reviewed back in 2014, although this version does tack on direct integration with other Kidde devices
And like the Homeboy, Kidde's RemoteLync doesn't have live streaming or an HD-quality resolution

Mounting magnetically anywhere - the Remotelync Camera can can pivot easily. The product will last up to three months every time it is charged.
